result.execSummary:
The defendant Miechelle L. Gardner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Called at 1:45 p.m., Defendant Miechelle L. Gardner in court with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sentencing statement made. Court sentenced defendant to 8 months jail, starting January 15, 2016 at 7 p.m. Huber granted under jail rules. Court not opposed to electronic monitoring. $518 costs, 60 days to pay fine or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts. Submit DNA sample, if not previously done. No jail credit. Court adjourned at 2:00 p.m.

Defendant, Miechelle L. Gardner, appeared pro se. Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. $2,000 recog. bond with felony conds. Time limits waived.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Hearing scheduled for November 7, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
